We're looking for a Creative Director, Asia to join our team in Singapore as part of our Design function.
Who you are
Do you love picturing an experience through the eyes of the customer and working out how to wow them? Does the idea of creating something that gives people goosebumps excite you? Are you never satisfied with the status quo? Do you come up with ideas that people think are a bit crazy? Do you appreciate challenging conventional thinking? Do you have an eye for detail and real creative flair?
Are you culturally curious with a passion for discovering new experiences and creative innovations; from the arts to AI and everything in between? Do you have a keen interest in and broad awareness of innovative brand to consumer and business to business experiential activations? Do you have proven creative team leadership experience and are you confident in working with autonomy in a fast moving, high growth business? Do you have the passion and experience to wow an audience through original and innovative live and digital experiences?
….Then you have found the right place.
We are looking for a unique mind that can ensure that our products, be they physical or digital, are as unboring as the industry we serve. Someone who doesn’t think about users as customers but as people. Someone who can get fixated on how to get under our audience’s skin and make them feel something powerful.
Role Overview
Money20/20 Asia will take place in Bangkok in April 2024 managed and produced by a dedicated team based in Southeast Asia. The Creative Director is managed by the Global VP Creative and will have the full support of the Money20/20 global creative team in London and New York.
IMPORTANT:
A deep understanding of the local and regional cultures of Thailand and Southeast Asia and first-hand experience of living and working in Southeast Asia are critical requirements of the role. The ideal candidate will also have a proven track record of hybrid creative work (live events / experiential and digital content) within the region and be fluent in both Central Thai and English languages
Key Responsibilities
  • Ensuring that creativity and the customer experience is at the heart of what we do
  • Reimagining and reinventing the event landscape from pre show to reviving the magic after the event, bringing in fresh ideas and your own innovative mindset, setting the vision and translating this into a blueprint for event execution. Identifying opportunities and concepts that elevate the customer experience driving loyalty and increasing retention
  • Working hand in hand with our Global VIP Creative, SVP Asia, and Chief Growth and Strategy Officer,you will establish what the industry needs (but may not know it yet) and transform this from a product vision into reality; from digital interaction to creating the blueprint of how each geography executes in order to deliver the highest levels of customer satisfaction measurable via revenue, retention and NPS
  • Leverage internal and external data sources such as the voice of customer, insights and analytics to fully understand our customers’ experience and how we use this to inform future decisions
  • As the guardian and champion of the blueprint for the Asia show, work in collaboration with Money20/20 Asia team and the respective projects teams to ensure the vision gets delivered on time, maintaining the awe, wonder and unboring approach that Money20/20 demands
  • Contributing to the planning sessions to ensure execution is in line with the product vision and strategy
  • Setting the Asia show’s visual identity and working with the larger design team to create the approved look book for SVP Asia and Operations team to execute from
  • Partner with the marketing team to ensure alignment with the global brand so that our vision and identity is translated into our marketing story
  • Develop health scores and necessary measures to ensure a proactive approach to our Customer Success endeavours
This list is not exhaustive and there may be other activities you are required to deliver。
Your Experience
  • Visionary - willing to challenge the norms, stretch the art of the possible with creative flair
  • Curious - drawing inspiration from far and wide and translating into action
  • Communication - a vision is nothing if you cannot articulate it clearly to others
  • Resilient - able to successfully manage multiple stakeholders and projects, keeping the customer at the heart of what you do
  • Agility - willing to fail fast, learn and adapt
  • Driven - sees things through to completion, without wavering
  • Strong interest in the Fintech Ecosystem that we serve
  • True passion for your work that leads to best in class results
  • Target and deadline driven
What We Offer
Our benefits package incorporates what we’re passionate about – unlocking your future, overall well-being and sustainability – whilst giving you control over your benefits.
  • Annual leave
  • Private medical insurance
  • Great learning and development opportunities
  • Option to opt into the Ascential Shares Scheme
Inclusive Workforce
At Ascential, our goal is to create a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable in bringing their authentic selves to work. We want all Ascential people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals.
Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
If you have any accessibility requirements that would make you more comfortable during the application and interview process, please let us know so that we can support you.
For more information on our culture, visit Ascential.com.
About Money 20/20
Ask anyone within the financial services/fintech industry what is the one, must-go-to event and you will likely get the same answer: Money20/20. In 2012 Money20/20 took the event world by storm and has been the pinnacle for our industry globally ever since. We understand though, that to stay on top, we must continue to reinvent ourselves and wow our customers - and the content team is a crucial element to this strategy.
Money20/20 is where the world of financial services and technology come together. Think traditional banks you have been using all your life and new digital only banks you have likely seen advertisements for across your social media. Think payments companies like PayPal, Visa, and Mastercard and big tech companies like Google, Apple, Meta and Uber. Think investors looking to back the next big thing and the regulators charged with keeping our money safe - we are where this community comes together to do business.
We started as live events that educate, excite, and connect and while that is still our foundation, we have recently extended our portfolio to include digital events and content experiences. This journey is just beginning… join us to see why we believe we are now in the golden age of fintech and how you can help leave your mark.

Brief summary of role:

The successful candidate will oversee OpenSpace's APAC regional sales development function, with a primary focus on creating and growing the opportunity pipeline through inbound and outbound programs, including Channel Development, Key Accounts Development and Marketing Coordination. This director will lead a team of talented regional sales development professionals as well as partner closely with Marketing, Sales, and Products to contribute to the pipeline and revenue growth efforts. The director will be accountable for opportunities, pipeline, and revenue targets in the APAC regions for both new business and expansion accounts. This leader will own and influence the sales development investment decisions, resource allocation, target setting, and team delivery of the business in APAC. This position will report to the VP of Sales and will be located in Singapore or Hong Kong, working remotely with our global team. This is a unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing company with a strong customer and revenue base and help define and grow the content marketing function. We have a great story to tell, our customers are changing how the world is built, and we need you to help us bring it to life.

What you will be doing:

  • Strategize, plan, execute, manage, and optimize pipeline generation programs and activities for New Business, Customer retention and Expansion, and Strategic Accounts
  • Partner with Sales leadership to identify the outbound target account list and campaigns to build pipeline, exceed business targets defined for the region, including SQLs, Pipeline, and Net New ARR
  • Lead hiring, onboarding, training, coaching, and development of a team of professionals in Sales Development and manage opportunity capacity planning to influence hiring and promotion cycles.
  • Responsible for accurate opportunity forecasts (weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually) leveraging data and supporting metrics
  • Provide regional leadership oversight to the Sales Development teams as well as set expectations with Sales leadership
  • Regularly provide an analysis of the regional competitive environment.
  • Proactively anticipates and mitigates obstacles, risks, and business disruptions
  • Gleans insight from metrics and uses this information to effectively transform initiatives. Identifies trends and patterns, predicts outcomes, and applies them in meaningful ways throughout all business units.
  • Be the face of OpenSpace in APAC, including media engagements, conferences and industry forums, meetings with local clients and ensure OpenSpace brand and values are reflected locally

What we are looking for:

  • 10+ years of direct sales experience leading a tech sales initiatives especially in transactional tech sales in the APAC market
  • 5+ years of experience building and operating enterprise sales development teams in the construction tech industry
  • 2+ years of experience as a second line sales development leader
  • Experience in construction or real estate industry, specifically construction or real estate technology sales
  • Demonstrated experience and success building quality pipeline for startup software and SaaS businesses growing at 3-5x multiple
  • Experience working with global teams required
  • Experience growing and developing a Sales/Marketing team for an undeveloped region is strongly preferred
  • Deep understanding of demand and pipeline generation with experience in both inbound and outbound target account strategies
  • Demonstrates a deep understanding of metrics and how to effectively analyze and develop action plans from data
  • Strong collaboration abilities with Sales, Marketing, and Product leadership.
  • Acute operational acumen with the ability to leverage data to make business decisions
  • Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills in English and other regional languages
  • Identifies new opportunities for developing new internal and external customer bases.
  • Ability to thrive in a remote-first organization
  • Entrepreneurial experience preferred

#LI-Remote

OpenSpace welcomes employees from varied backgrounds and walks of life, and it's reflected in our diverse community. OpenSpace is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Our mission is to move more with less. The world is changing, people want shorter and cheaper journeys and their goods to be delivered faster. Gone are the days when manual planning suffices. SWAT is building the technology to allow fleet operators and logistic companies to compete in this new world.


The patented algorithm we developed solves an academic problem (researched since the 1980s) called the “pickup and delivery with time windows” – in layman terms: "how do you move the most number of objects (people or parcels), using the least number of vehicles, in the shortest time or distance possible". SWAT is the market share leader in pooling optimization technology in South East Asia and operates in countries like Singapore, Japan, The Philippines and Thailand. We are tackling some of the most challenging transport/logistics problems in the world’s most congested cities. Many large corporations from different industries such as shipping, logistics, airline, pharmaceutical, utilities, banking, property development and public transport use our technology to improve employee commute convenience and happiness and save costs. It’s also greener, more sustainable. Our customers are governments, public transport operators or large companies with challenging employee commute needs.


Come join our AI SaaS high growth tech startup if you also have the ambition to make a big impact in making the world move more sustainably. There is so much more we want to do and it will be a great place for you to learn and grow with the company.

A Research Assistant position is currently available in the Earth Observatory of Singapore (EOS). The Earth Observatory of Singapore was founded with a mission to conduct fundamental research on earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, tsunamis and climate change in and around Southeast Asia, towards safer and more sustainable societies:
https://earthobservatory.sg/
The Asian School of the Environment is an interdisciplinary school that integrates earth and environmental life science, ecology, engineering and technology, human ecology, humanities, and the social sciences to addressing key environmental challenges related to climate change, geohazards, sustainablity and global environmental change, with a focus on Southeast Asia:
https://www.ntu.edu.sg/ase
.
The successful candidate will join a team at the Earth Observatory of Singapore (EOS) and Asian School of the Environment (ASE) at Nanyang Technological University who are working towards developing automated capabilities for remote-sensing based monitoring of natural hazards and mapping of natural disasters across Southeast Asia. The project aims to map floods, land subsidence, volcano monitoring, tectonic deformation, coastal change and earthquake studies, and to provide timely information to regional decision makers and disaster responders across the region.
Job Responsibilities
  • Works as a software engineer on the project
  • Help with software development of new features and mission control of a near-real-time, partially automated system that will use remote sensing data for monitoring of hazards and mapping of disasters
  • Development of additional features in our web-based interface according to user requirements
  • Coordination with scientists at the Earth Observatory of Singapore to integrate post-processing algorithms for SAR data into the disaster response system
  • Troubleshoot issues raised and develop fixes to ensure our system is always ready for response
Job Requirements
  • Bachelors degree in computer science, remote sensing, data analytics, earth science, or natural hazards
  • Strong experience with Python is a requirement. Experience working with cloud-computing platforms and distributed systems, and/or in using remote sensing to map natural hazards and disasters is advantageous
  • Willingness to learn tools associated with cloud-based distributed systems, web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Docker, Elasticsearch)
  • Willingness to learn scientific processing software and tools.
  • Strong English and communication skills, both written and oral as medium of communication within the institute and for ease of communication with international collaborators
  • Strong program management skills (project workflow planning, trouble shooting, etc.)

Interested applicants should send a CV, with list of publications (if any), statement of career goals, and the names of three referees. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

What sets us apart is our systematic diagnostic & evaluation evidence-based approach to discovering key drivers of sales revenue performance and the root cause of what’s hindering & enabling our client’s current performance. Our innovative solutions are tailored to meet our client’s specific requirements and our consultants possess actual business and market experiences of which they will be able to share “real world” best practices and engage well with the delegates.   • Develop UI/UX prototypes

In a world where trades are happening faster than ever to answer our needs, where sustainability is not just an option anymore, clarity and trust in the information we trade with are a must.

So, say hello to Kpler! We exist to facilitate sustainable and efficient trade to meet the changing needs of our world. To do so we've built a Data-as-a-Service solution that does exactly that across the lifecycle of a trade.

Our solution aggregates data from hundreds of sources including radar and satellite imagery as well as logistics, governmental, shipping databases and more. Intelligently connecting the dots across fragmented information landscapes, we bring to our clients a unique, real-time understanding of the trades happening all over the world, by giving them access to live information about the movement of cargos, the availability of vessels as well as commodity storage.

To support this endeavor, we have teams in more than 7 countries and 9 key locations (Brussels, Paris, Hyères, London, Vienna, Dubai, Singapore, Houston and New York). With individuals of various backgrounds, diverse skills, and international experiences, being global & inclusive is in our DNA!

What you'll do

We are looking for a proactive, hands-on Sales Development Representative with the ambition to hunt for new business leads while becoming a subject matter expert on the Kpler product suite and commodity market opportunities. Reporting to the Regional Sales Lead, this role requires a driven individual who is able to achieve and excel in targets. We are a fast-growing company and need people who will take initiative and ownership when generating new business leads. There is a great opportunity to progress within the business with our guidance and training, you will effectively communicate the Kpler value proposition and set up meetings for the Sales Executives in the region.

As a Sales Development Representative at Kpler, you will:

  • Identify the right group/users within an organization and engage them in a conversation about our
different products
  • Research and Map Clients and Target Prospects in the Industry within APAC
  • Generate and qualify business opportunities through professional, dedicated prospecting via multiple
channels
  • Develop an outreach strategy to drive appointments with Sales Representatives
  • Working with the Sales team to tailor a unique sales pitch/value proposition to prospects
  • Use a variety of tools relevant to Asia Pacific countries to research prospective leads.
  • Develop OUTBOUND Leads through cold calling, cold emailing, and networking amongst other means.
  • Develop excellent Qualified leads to hand over to the sales team.
  • Follow up on leads and conduct research to identify potential prospects.
  • Prepare and analyze sales pipeline reports and dashboards.
  • Support Commercial/Account Managers with their lead-generation activities
  • Enrich CRM Platform (Salesforce) with relevant and precise information about Clients, Prospects, leads
and qualified opportunities
  • Work alongside the marketing team to capitalize on engagement generated from events and their lead
generation activity
  • Meet and exceed all quarterly and annual sales quota
  • Keep track of Industry Events in order to have meaningful conversations with Prospects and contribute
to Regional Marketing Strategy

About you
  • An intrinsic drive to be successful and show quick adaptation
  • Strong communication and presentation skills (verbal and written) in at least 2 Asian languages
(English, Chinese, Japanese, Korean )
  • A proactive, ‘hunter’ mentality
  • Highly personable, and confident interacting in person and over the phone with senior personnel
  • 1-3 years of telemarketing and/or inside sales experience.
  • Experience in sales development and/or sales within SaaS B2B business is strongly preferred.
  • Engaging copywriting skills and experience in delivering compelling emails and communications to
stand out from the crowd
  • Organised, structured, able to work under pressure, but effective and capable to meet deadlines
  • Professional customer-centric manner and sensitivity to various Asian cultures
  • Desire to learn, and a keen interest in developing a career within a high-performing sales culture
  • Tech-savvy with a genuine interest in disruptive technologies and current market trend
  • Enjoys working in a dynamic start-up culture, contributing new and creative Ideas

Our values

  • Be humble - We always place the interests of the collective before your own.
  • Respect and care for others - We make every person feel comfortable in their own beliefs, decisions, and perspectives.
  • Take responsibility - We take ownership of our actions.
  • Act with integrity -We are honest and transparent in all your dealings.
  • Be bold - We push the boundaries in order to improve and grow.

You’ll get to work in a truly global environment, with more than 30 nationalities speaking more than 15 languages.

Our People Pledge

Don’t meet every single requirement? Research shows that women and people of color are less likely than others to apply if they feel like they don’t match 100% of the job requirements. Don’t let the confidence gap stand in your way, we’d love to hear from you! We understand that experience comes in many different forms and are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

Kpler is committed to providing a fair, inclusive and diverse work-environment. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to better understand the needs and interests of our diverse, global community. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and are an equal opportunity employer.

Backlight is a media technology company that improves video content ideation, production, post production and distribution. Launched in 2022 with funding from PSG, Backlight acquired media software businesses ftrack, Celtx, iconik, Wildmoka and Zype. Video-forward organizations utilize Backlight to solve their mission-critical business and operational challenges.

The Sales Development Representative (SDR) will focus on generating interest in Backlight Streaming through researching and prospecting into accounts that have been previously identified in our ICP. Reporting into the Sales function, this role works between marketing and sales and is designed to connect these organizations through strategic cold and warm sales tactics with the goal of building a quality pipeline for the company.

While this is an entry-level growth position, you will be at the epicenter of action in a quickly growing organization.

What you'll do:

  • Prospect for new business, researching companies and individuals that meet criteria for potential use of our products
  • Qualify inbound inquiries
  • Work to meet and exceed monthly goals defined to maximize deal flow with outbound emails, calls, LinkedIn Messaging, setting up meetings, etc.
  • Set up demos with qualified prospects for Backlight Streaming Account Executives
  • Executing high-quality, strategic outbound initiatives to connect with decision-makers and influencers in target accounts
  • Occasionally lead intro calls and close new business opportunities

Skills & knowledge you should possess:

  • 1-3 years' experience in lead generation, or sales, ideally within SaaS businesses
  • Outstanding phone, prospecting, sales, customer service, and interpersonal skills
  • Experience with Salesforce or other CRM software
  • Ability to build relationships with potential customers, understand their environment, and introduce new concepts to solve problems
  • Ability to build relationships with internal stakeholders
  • A strong work ethic and understanding that self-discipline and hard work are a minimum standard for success in Sales
  • Proven ability to learn a sales process and improve it through collaboration with your peers
  • Proven ability to learn and master selling in a new and technically challenging domain
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize workload to maximize efficiency
  • Represent the company and our products with a high degree of professionalism
  • Creative and outside the box thinker is a must

Outcomes of the role


By month one, fully onboarded in Organizational structure and all Sales processes.

By month three, be fully ramped in all sales processes, focusing on sales pipeline, prospecting, activities

By month six, consistently hitting and exceeding quotas and taking on more responsibility (leading calls, etc.)


Performance indicators

  • Meetings Scheduled
  • Pipeline Generated
  • Meetings Held

At Backlight, we provide software that empowers creativity and collaboration throughout the video value chain. Each business unit is unique. Collectively, we share a culture of mutual trust and respect, inclusivity, and a passion for making an impact in the lives of our customers. We are always on the lookout for talented people to join our team!

About Certis

We are a leading security services organisation. We put technology to work in making the world a safer place. Our mission is that as trusted partners, we protect lives and assets, and deliver integrated critical services. By empowering our people, our goal is to enable our communities to stay safe and thriving. We offer a broad range of opportunities and career pathways for our people to grow and explore their potential. We believe that people, equipped with innovative thinking and technological capabilities will make the world safer, smarter and better.


Life at Certis

If you are a passionate individual looking for opportunities to expand your skills, and purposeful work instead of just a ‘job’, we would love to hear from you. At Certis, no two days look alike. Our work calendars are filled with chances to collaborate with others, and bring new initiatives to life. Whether you’re looking to improve a process, or have an innovative idea awaiting a technology solve, we want you to bring your ideas to the table. About ByteDance

Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.


Why Join Us

At ByteDance, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for millions of users across all of our products. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at ByteDance.


About the Team

BytePlus is a business unit in ByteDance and provides intelligent services powered by industry-leading technologies. BytePlus helps enterprise customers build what's next for their business. Leveraging Bytedance's cutting-edge technologies, we are devoted to developing innovative products and solutions to shape the future. You can help us to achieve our mission.


Overview

The Creative Designer will work closely with Marketing, Sales, and Product teams to develop materials that articulate our brand and product value. You will be responsible for designing customer-facing materials, mainly videos, not limited to presentations, graphics, and assets for advertising campaigns. The role will include conceptualizing updates to our current materials, focusing on mainly video creations, creating designs for new content, and working to update existing materials from our overseas team.


What you will be doing:

  • Supporting the creation and content of all BytePlus videos and other visual design materials
  • Brainstorming with marketers, copywriters, and brand strategists to bring content plans to life from concept to execution
  • Supporting the sales team by creating appealing videos, animations, and other materials.
  • Partnering and collaborating with overseas teams to repurpose existing assets for team usage
  • Contributing to the development of the initial creative process
  • Stay on top of the latest design and digital trends, and ensure they're reflected in our creative assets


Qualifications


What you should have:

1. Bachelor’s degree in Multimedia Design, Arts, Graphic Design, Communication Design, Visual Communication, or any other related discipline

2. At least 3 years of relevant experience in digital design, and video creation

3. A strong portfolio that showcases your creative ideation, compositing, and technical abilities in video/multimedia design

4. Proficient in multimedia design software such as AE

5. Good communication skills to articulate your concepts in a clear, and concise manner

6. Highly proficient in all aspects of design, with an excellent eye for high-quality artwork

7. Ability to meet deadlines and be well-organized

8. A keen interest in technology, independently staying up to date with the latest developments.


ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

At Ripple, we're building a world where value moves like information does today. It's big, it's bold, and we're already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.

If you're ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.

THE WORK:

Our people team is growing and we have a need for a senior-level HR Business Partner to be the bridge between HR, the business and other cross-functional teams, leading critical people and performance-focused changes that align with our strong company culture and values.

We're looking for a Senior Manager, HR Business Partner who will partner closely with leaders across our business to align people and strategy. You will have an opportunity to drive significant business growth and make an immediate impact through your expertise in organizational design, talent management strategy, and leadership coaching, all while acting as a steward of Ripple's culture. As part of our People function, your #1 goal is to design, build and execute the talent strategy that drives our success. This role will be based in our Singapore office but supporting key markets in Dubai, India and Australia.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

  • Be a trusted advisor, providing support from the executives to the employees within the teams that you own.
  • Works closely with management in the implementation of corporate policies related to human resources, organizational and employee development at the business unit or division level.
  • Execute global and local HR programs and processes (e.g., talent management, succession planning, performance management, development planning, compensation planning)
  • Provide business leaders with data, findings, and recommendations of client organizations' "pulse" by assessing trends in performance, span of control, employee engagement, manager feedback, attrition and turnover, etc.
  • Solve problems and get to the root cause of any issue, no matter how complex; design and quickly implement solutions
  • Collaborate with others (People team COEs, cross-functional partners, HRBP peers, etc.) to build world class initiatives
  • Coach and influence managers on how to build an impactful team
  • Partner with our D&I team to effectively execute our diversity, equity, and inclusion strategy

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:

  • 10+ years of experience in HR. Deep and progressive experience as a strategic HR Business Partner.
  • Interpersonal skills: Excellent communication skills and ability to coach, influence, and partner with various levels of employees. Demonstrated experience and a passion for strong collaboration with others (People team COEs, cross-functional partners, HRBP peers, etc.).
  • Change management skills: Ability to add value through change management; help pivot the culture and improve overall effectiveness of the business and teams.
  • Resiliency: A successful candidate must be resilient in building relationships with the business executives, exerting pressure when pressure may be needed, but also choosing their priorities carefully. You are comfortable in ambiguity and can pull relevant components out of complex situations to connect the dots and make sound decisions - you know when to ask for help.
  • Leads with inclusive actions: Understands the importance of building a diverse and inclusive workforce on a global scale.
  • Analytical Skills: Comfort with data and using data to provide insights to help advise and influence business decisions.
  • Project Management skills: establish project objectives, analyze data, prioritize responsibilities, execute project deliverables, track and measure to successful completion
  • Bias for action: Bias for action, strong work ethic, and desire to achieve excellence
  • Strong business acumen: Recognizes and enjoys the business side of business. Has knowledge about the organization's operations and how talent management affects each. Approaches problem solving from a business-first perspective.

WHO WE ARE:

Do Your Best Work

  • The opportunity to build in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
  • A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact. A professional development budget to support other modes of learning.
  • Thrive in an environment where no matter what race, ethnicity, gender, origin, or culture they identify with, every employee is a respected, valued, and empowered part of the team.
  • Ripple is Flexible First: you have the option to work from home, from our offices, or a combination of the two around our centers of gravity (15 global offices).
  • Weekly all-company meeting - business updates and ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team
  • We come together for moments that matter which include team offsites, team bonding activities, happy hours and more!

Take Control of Your Finances

  • Competitive salary, bonuses, and equity
  • Competitive benefits that cover physical and mental healthcare, retirement, family forming, and family support
  • Employee giving match
  • Mobile phone stipend

Take Care of Yourself

  • Twice a quarter R&R days so you can rest and recharge
  • Generous wellness reimbursement and weekly onsite & virtual programming
  • Generous vacation policy - work with your manager to take time off when you need it
  • Industry-leading parental leave policies. Family planning benefits.
  • Catered lunches, fully-stocked kitchens with premium snacks/beverages, and plenty of fun events

Benefits listed above are for full-time employees.

At CHANEL, we believe the uniqueness of each individual increases the diversity and vibrancy of our teams, and we foster an inclusive culture so that everyone can perform at their best. We strongly encourage your application, and value the perspective and experience you can bring to CHANEL.

A BIT ABOUT US

We're at the forefront of one of the most exciting evolutions of our generation - remote employment. No longer do employers have to hire according to geography, and no longer do employees have to worry about proximity to work and daily commutes. Today, companies can hire the best talent they can find, anywhere in the world. But they need digital solutions to help them streamline the process.

We are Multiplier! Our global employment platform empowers companies to contract staff all across the world, while managing the complexities of local compliance, labour contracts, payroll, benefits and taxes - all from one software system. It's a game changer!

We're on a mission to impact economies of scale, and disrupt the traditional employer of record (EOR) space. We're backed by some of the best in the game (Sequoia and Golden Gate Ventures), led by domain level experts, scaling massively, and seeking brilliant like minded enthusiasts to join our team.

A BIT ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

We're going to 20x our business in 2023, and are building a world class sales org to help us get there. Our Regional Sales Directors are responsible for helping us build world class sales teams, processes, and to deliver on exceptionally ambitious revenue targets. We expect to grow from less than 5 sales reps in the Americas, to more than 30 this year alone. Sales Managers will be responsible for hiring Business Development Reps (BDRs) to help drive outbound pipeline and Account Executives (AEs) to close those prospects.

As an SM, you'll be reporting to the Global Sales Director (we'll place a Sales Director in-market ASAP), and work closely with your peers and cross functional stakeholders. Process, efficiency, and tenacity will be critical to our/your success in this role.

What you'll do:

  • Consistently deliver on sales targets for your team of up to 8 reps.
  • Manage and train BDRs to drive consistent pipeline through outbound sales efforts.
  • Train AEs to deliver incredibly effective demos, and nurture prospects to closed-won.
  • Recruit, onboard, and develop exceptional sales talent across all business groups (BDRs and AEs).
  • Help build career plans for your staff, and maximise retention of top talent.
  • Help us build a predictable, repeatable, and scalable sales engine.
  • Provide access to a rolodex of high value prospects through your personal and professional network.
  • Ensure the team are using our tech stack (HubSpot, ZoomInfo, SalesLoft, and Linkedin Sales Navigator) as intended, while keeping meticulous track of all sales deals and pipeline.
  • Deliver on quarterly OKRs, with a laser focus on data.

What you'll bring:

  • Min 8 years B2B sales experience (ideally in SaaS), with a track record of achieving quota.
  • Min 2 years of quota attainment as manager, out of the last 3 years.
  • An exceptional appreciation for the complexities of your craft.
  • An affinity to work (thrive!) as a remote employee.
  • The ability to work independently, problem solve proactively, and collaborate effectively.
  • Excellent leadership, communication and presentation skills.
  • A process oriented approach to sales.
  • Work ethic beyond the norm, and a commitment to excellence as a leader.

What we'll provide for you:

  • Ability to contribute to this business at a high level.
  • Autonomy within your role.
  • Ability to work fully-remotely.
  • Working with a compassionate, energetic, inspired, ambitious, global, and diverse team.
  • Opportunity to grow within a fast-growth business.
  • Competitive benefits, compensation, and culture of recognition.
  • Unlimited holiday policy.
  • A commitment to positively impact your career.

A BIT ABOUT YOU

You're a company builder, not just a sales leader. You absolutely love working with a unique and inspired workforce, and being part of a dispersed team. Startups excite you because you covet the opportunity to contribute to building something special, early on. You understand the art and science of sales, and use systems and mathematics to succeed. You've been successful in management, and relish the opportunity to grow. You're progressively minded, creative, accountable, and quirky in your own way. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

Multiplier is an equal opportunity employer: we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global platform for desirable pre- loved fashion. We transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future, by empowering a community to drive change. Curated by its trusted community of fashion lovers, members inspire one another whilst selling and buying unique pieces from each others wardrobes.

Encouraging consumers to join the circular economy as the sustainable alternative to throw-away fashion, the platform is unique due to its highly engaged community, its rare desirable inventory and its authenticity and quality control process. Launched in Paris in October 2009, Vestiairecollective.com has close to 15 million members across 80 countries worldwide with offices in cities Paris, New York, Berlin, Hong Kong, Seoul, Singapore, Shanghai, Ho Chi Minh City and Tokyo.
Our values have built our success and made us who we are as a fast-growing company because we think collective: we work with style, with entrepreneurial spirit and with passion. We currently have a diverse global team of 1000 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Vestiaire Collective is looking for a HR Business Partner to join our HR team, based in Singapore. You will report to the VP People, APAC and is responsible for aligning business objectives with employees and management in designated business units/perimeters. The position formulates partnerships across the HR function to deliver value-added service to management and employees that reflects the business objectives of the organization.HR BP should be aware of industry best practices in APAC to be able to evaluate and implement in the organization.


What you'll do

Participate in the definition of the HR strategy :

  • Understand and decline the HR strategy of the company according to the regions managed.
  • Determine the priority projects according to the strategy and the expectations of the staff.

Advise and support leadership team:

  • Responsible for engaging end to end with the local and regional business functions for their employee needs.
  • Provide support to managers in the application of labour laws and regulations and in the development of teams (recruitment, career management, performance appraisal etc.).

Implement of HR projects in APAC

  • Autonomously lead the multiple HR projects corresponding to the HR strategy Expand the business in APAC e.g set up legal entities in APAC, prepare and timely amendment of employment contracts and handbooks by country (China, Japan, Korea, Vietnam and etc.) and all HR documentation for these countries.
  • Follow up on HRIS all changes - change of reporting, cost center, department, Manager and other adhoc duties assigned.
  • Responsible for all the queries around policies and procedures are resolved in effectiveness and within time.
  • Identify measures that can build the connection in the organization – Fun @ Work, Trainings, and Communications for awareness etc.
  • Assess the satisfaction of employees with the HR performance delivered and the expected results.

Who you are

  • A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in HRBP role especially APAC regional experience.
  • Working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines, including compensation practices, organizational diagnosis, employee relations, diversity, performance management, labour laws and etc.
  • Prior experience gained both in an established as well as high growth/startup companies would be highly regarded
  • Knowledge of different functions in a digital / Ecommerce environment ideally, but not mandatory
  • Strong organization, communication, and conflict resolution skills
  • Demonstrate autonomy, flexibility, firmness and strength of conviction
  • Enjoy working as a team-player and learning from others.
  • Fluent English (other language skills are useful) and excellent communication skills

What we offer

  • A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
  • The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
  • Significant investment in your learning and growth
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to develop an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our fashion activist community.

The Snr Software Quality Engineer oversees and plans quality control tests and analysis of software to meet or exceed specified standards and end user requirements. He/She manages professional employees, sets priorities, testing parameters and quality assurance automation frameworks, and has accountability for the performance and results of the team. He develops departmental plans and priorities to address resource and operational challenges. He guides decisions and problem-solving through policies and procedures and business plan. He provides technical guidance to stakeholders and advocates quality assurance best practices.


As someone who manages the quality of software products from end to end, he is able to readily integrate and apply knowledge from multiple disciplines across software and quality assurance. He is able to develop innovative and effective solutions to issues encountered, communicate his plans and advice in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action.


Implement quality assurance strategy

  • Develop quality assurance strategies addressing all phases of product development
  • Oversee the day-to-day management of all functional areas of quality assurance
  • Drive application of new technologies, compliance and security standards
  • Advocate for software quality and excellence throughout the organisation


Develop software quality guidelines

  • Endorse software quality guidelines
  • Align quality standards with best practices and business goals
  • Establish processes and mechanisms to inspect software and report quality issues
  • Establish policy for documentation of procedures and end user experience of products
  • Drive compliance with defined software quality specifications
  • Resolve escalated issues of non-compliance with software quality specifications


Oversee software development process

  • Develop plans for quality assurance tasks
  • Leads project teams to achieve quality assurance milestones and objectives
  • Perform solution assurance activities for software development proposals to ensure viability and uncover potential risks
  • Drive the achievement of higher quality standards by developers and the quality assurance team
  • Approve new solutions, best practices, design approaches and technologies
  • Retain accountability for software projects meeting timelines, budgets and quality standards


Guide quality assurance testing

  • Establish quality assurance strategy for software
  • Lead the design and implementation of testing frameworks, test infrastructure and tools
  • Oversee the execution of all test scripts and end user experience tests
  • Support recreation and validation of user reported issues
  • Provide general supervision and technical guidance for quality assurance testing
  • Recommend solutions to resolve significant quality lapses
  • Retain accountability for software products complying with technical specifications and quality standards


Optimise quality assurance processes

  • Drive continuous improvement in quality assurance
  • Develop sustainable quality assurance processes
  • Endorse improvements to optimise quality assurance processes
  • Secure buy-in for new investments in quality assurance process
  • Develop quality assurance metrics


Manage projects

  • Plan project timelines and resources for quality assurance activities
  • Drive use of project management tools and processes
  • Communicate project objectives and updates at critical junctures to obtain buy in from stakeholders
  • Coordinate interdepartmental activities for software development and deployment
  • Anticipate software release challenges
  • Monitor all operations that affect software quality assurance

• Be a member of the product development team.
  • Enhance existing security products and develop new innovative security products.
  • Learn how to work independently and in a team.

Job Requirements

  • Candidate must possess at least a Diploma or Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication) or equivalent. Required skill(s): JavaScript, CSS and Java.
  • Expertise in other programming languages are advantageous.
  • Multiple full-time positions are available.
  • Minimum 1 year experience in front-end development.

Hardware Environment

CPU: IBM zSeries Server


Software Environment

a. Server Operating System : z/OS

b. Development Environment : TSO, ISPF

c. On-line Environment : CICS Transaction Server

d. Data Security : z/OS Security Server

e. DBMS : DB2, VSAM

f. Sort Utility : DF/SORT

g. Tape Management : CA-1

h. Programming Language : Enterprise COBOL for z/OS, COBOL/CICS, (Command

Level), SAS,

i. Tool : Xpediter, File-Aid, Change Man, CodeCoverage

j. Middleware : Websphere MQ for z/OS


Working Experience And Skill Requirements

3.1 Mandatory Basic Enterprise Server Skill Requirements for Mainframe

All Programmers in ES 1 to ES 7 MUST meet the following requirements: -

a. Must be able to speak and write English proficiently;

b. Have at least three (3) years' post graduate programming experience on IBM mainframe z/OS and CICS operating environment using TSO, ISPF, COBOL for z/OS, CICS COBOL, JCL and other utilities;

c. Have at least three (3) years' post graduate hands-on programming experience using COBOL for z/OS and CICS COBOL in processing IBM VSAM and sequential files and able to maintain VSAM file structure;

d. Have at least three (3) years' post graduate working experience in preparing JCL for compilation, linkage and execution of COBOL for z/OS programs, Sort and other IBM Utilities;

e. Have at least three (3) years' post graduate hands-on programming experience using DB2/SQL in COBOL for z/OS and CICS COBOL programs;

f. Able to use ISPF Editor to write and maintain programs and JCLs;

g. Able to code BMS Macro and the various field macro parameters to define all the map elements and their characteristics and to assemble the coded source into physical and symbolic map layout for the application program;

h. Able to handle job compilation using JES2 and analyse compilation result using SDSF facilities;

i. Able to debug JCLs and programs written in COBOL for z/OS and CICS COBOL;

j. Able to use ISPF and JCLs and programs to prepare test data and test data sets;

k. Able to conduct unit, module, functional and volume tests; to analyse the test results and to take corrective actions.

Job Description


The Programmers shall be required to:

a. Code, modify, test, correct and document new and existing programs using assigned languages, tools and coding conventions;

b. Code, modify, test, correct and document new and existing JCLs;

c. Analyse the program specification to produce all testing condition and produce test data based on identified test conditions;

d. Prepare JCL to load DB2 table or define VSAM files with the extracted test data for performing the various tests, eg stress test, regression test, performance test etc. When tested successfully, repeat the process for creating production DB2 & VSAM files;

e. Prepare and maintain program and system documentation;

f. Assist in establishing file structures and processing logic requirements;

g. Produce deliverables according to group standards and procedures;

h. Assist Project Leaders in the study and design of application systems and work coordination, project management and user training work;

i. Troubleshooting and supporting end-users in the implementation and maintenance of application systems;

j. Train other contract programmers in the relevant skills;

k. Participate in Disaster Recovery activities eg simulation exercises at Disaster Recovery site;

l. Learn / pick up new programming skills related to System Development and Maintenance as assigned by the supervisors; and/or

m. Any other tasks related to System Development and Maintenance as may be assigned by the supervisors.
